ArticleTitle.sentence: Signals transduced through the CD4 molecule on T lymphocytes activate NF-kappa B.

event.clue: Signals transduced through the CD4 molecule on T lymphocytes activate NF-kappa B.
Signals transduced through the CD4 molecule on T lymphocytes activate NF-kappa B.
Signals transduced through the CD4 molecule on T lymphocytes activate NF-kappa B.

AbstractText.sentence: We have demonstrated that native envelope glycoproteins of HIV-1, gp160 can induce activation of the transcription factor, NF-kappa B.

event.clue: We have demonstrated that native envelope glycoproteins of HIV-1, gp160 can induce activation of the transcription factor, NF-kappa B.
We have demonstrated that native envelope glycoproteins of HIV-1, gp160 can induce activation of the transcription factor, NF-kappa B.

AbstractText.sentence: The stimulatory effects of gp160 are mediated through the CD4 molecule, since pretreatment with soluble CD4 abrogates its activity.

event.clue: The stimulatory effects of gp160 are mediated through the CD4 molecule, since pretreatment with soluble CD4 abrogates its activity.
The stimulatory effects of gp160 are mediated through the CD4 molecule, since pretreatment with soluble CD4 abrogates its activity.

AbstractText.sentence: The gp160-induced NF-kappa B complex consists of p65, p50 and c-rel proteins.

event.clue: The gp160-induced NF-kappa B complex consists of p65, p50 and c-rel proteins.
The gp160-induced NF-kappa B complex consists of p65, p50 and c-rel proteins.

AbstractText.sentence: The stimulatory effect of gp160 on NF-kappa B activation is protein synthesis independent, is dependent upon protein tyrosine phosphorylation, and abrogated by inhibitors of protein kinase C.

event.clue: The stimulatory effect of gp160 on NF-kappa B activation is protein synthesis independent, is dependent upon protein tyrosine phosphorylation, and abrogated by inhibitors of protein kinase C.

AbstractText.sentence: The gp160-mediated activation of NF-kappa B in CD4 positive T cells may be involved in biological effects, e.g., enhanced HIV replication, hypergammaglobulinemia, increased cytokine secretion, hypercellularity in bone marrow and apoptosis.
